Apollo 11 Code

Posted to Mottr.am by
Jack
on 22 July 2009. Tags: 1960s code
Short URL: http://mottr.am/11

The code that got men on the moon is now available.

Lines 179 and 180 of the Lunar Landing Guidance Equations are a little worrying:

TC BANKCALL # TEMPORARY, I HOPE HOPE HOPE
CADR STOPRATE # TEMPORARY, I HOPE HOPE HOPE

See also: Tales from the Lunar Module Guidance Computer, by Don Eyles.

Commenting via Twitter

If you have a Twitter account and would like to reply to this post, just tweet what you'd like to say, and make sure to put #mot_11 somewhere in your tweet.

The gobbledygook beginning with '#' is called a 'hashtag', and makes it easy for this site to search Twitter for your tweet, and display it on the correct page.

Alternatively, you can tweet about this post and include its short URL, http://mottr.am/11, and your tweet will be displayed automatically, whether you use the hashtag or not.

If you don't have a Twitter account, feel free to send me an email instead, and I'll update the post with your comments: j@ck.mottr.am
